output.answer: RAG stands for Retrieval Augmented Generation, a model or system combining retrieval and generation components to boost performance in natural language processing (NLP) tasks. It operates within a framework involving six key components: Pre-Retrieval, Retrieval, Generation, Augmentation, RAG Evaluation, and Tools. This structured approach categorizes different tools and techniques applicable in the RAG pipeline.

output.answer: RAG, or Retrieval-Augmented Generation, is a natural language processing framework that combines retrieval and generation components to enhance task performance. It is structured into several components: pre-retrieval, retrieval, generation, augmentation, evaluation, and tools for implementation. RAG aims to improve the accuracy and efficiency of NLP tasks through techniques such as context expansion and response re-ranking. Its applications include hybrid and multimodal search systems and it has been actively researched in the NLP community.
